page.title: 02Colliery slagheaps.
page.content:
Slagheaps are a feature of coalmining areas like ours.They are large heaps of slag-the waste product of coalmining.
Rockingham colliery used to employ many local people.It has now closed and all that is left of the landscape is waste and derelict land.Very little of this land has been re-claimed and the site resembles a large black hill. At the side of the old colliery there is a coke-handling storage depot.Some of this coke comes from as far away as France and Wales.
Tankersley colliery slagheap has been grassed over and is now used for grazing and for hay.In winter,when it has snowed,children 'sledge'down it on plastic bags.
